Treatment options for this level of obstructive sleep apnea include CPAP therapy, best treatment option, or a custom fabricated mandibular advancement device (MAD). In addition, behavioral modifications such as weight loss (if applicable), abstaining from alcohol/sedating medications/tobacco (if applicable) near bedtime, and avoidance of sleep in supine position are suggested. If CPAP is chosen, it can be initiated either through a dedicated CPAP titration study (preferred) or through an auto-titrating CPAP machine (APAP) initially set to 5-12 cm of water. Close clinical follow-up is recommended with use of CPAP data downloads to confirm both compliance and efficacy of treatment.  If a MAD (worn nightly in conjunction with a positional therapy device) is chosen, a follow-up sleep study should be undertaken while using this device to confirm efficacy.
